id: The Little Drummer Girl, episode 2 recap: interrogations, flashbacks and noxious oranges
paragraph:
The BBC’s beguiling Sunday-night Le Carré adaptation cracked into gear with fake romance, fill-us-in flashbacks and cars full of Semtex. Here are all the talking points from episode two…“Who are you people?” “We are friends. Non-sectarian, non-aligned friends, deeply concerned, like you, with the many wrong directions the world is taking.” We last left budding actress Charmian “Charlie” Ross (Florence Pugh) screeching up to the Mossad agents’ Athenian designer-house HQ (was that high-speed driving just to disorientate her?).
